Package socialnetwork.repository

Interface Repository0<MAIL,​E extends Entity<MAIL>>

Type Parameters:
MAIL - - type E must have an attribute of type ID
E - - type of entities saved in repository
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFileRepository0, InMemoryRepository0, UtilizatorFile0
public interface Repository0<MAIL,​E extends Entity<MAIL>>
CRUD operations repository interface

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      java.lang.Iterable<E> findAll()
      Returns:
      all entities

    • findRelations

      java.util.List<Prietenie> findRelations()
      Returns:
      all relations

    • save

      E save​(E entity)
      Parameters:
      entity - entity must be not null
      Returns:
      null- if the given entity is saved otherwise returns the entity (id already exists)
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the entity is not valid
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given entity is null. *
      RepoException - if the entity already exists

    • delete

      E delete​(E entity)
      removes the entity with the specified id
      Parameters:
      entity - mail must be not null
      Returns:
      the removed entity or null if there is no entity with the given mail
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given mail is null.

    • add_relation

      E add_relation​(java.lang.String mail1, java.lang.String mail2)
      adds relation between users with mail1 and mail2
      Parameters:
      mail1 - - String , mail for user1 mail1 must not be null and must match a regex
      mail2 - - String , mail for user2 mail2 must not be null and must match a regex
      Returns:
      null if the relation was added successfully
      Throws:
      RepoException - if the relation already exists

    • delete_relation

      E delete_relation​(java.lang.String mail1, java.lang.String mail2)
      delets relation between users with mail1 and mail2
      Parameters:
      mail1 - - String , mail for user1 mail1 must not be null and match a regex
      mail2 - - String , mail for user2 mail2 must not be null and match a regex
      Returns:
      null if the relation was deleted successfully
      Throws:
      RepoException - if the relation does not exist
